task.title: Integrating Sametime with HCL Domino
task.shortdesc: This topic includes the procedure to enable LTPA when Sametime is integrated with the Domino server for use with web based mail, Verse and iNotes.

prereq.p: Before you start you need an LTPA key which as an example can be generated by WebSphere Liberty. For more information on using WebSphere Liberty to generate LTPA keys, see .
You also must configure the LTPA keys on the Sametime server.

context.p: To configure the Domino server, you must create a Web SSO configuration document and import the WebSphere LTPA keys. The following procedure describes the steps which are completed on the Domino mail server.

step.cmd: Open the names.nsf and select the Web Configurations. Edit the Web SSO LtpaToken document.
step.info: If a Web SSO LtpaToken document does not exit, it must be created from the Notes or Admin client Create menu. Then click Keys Import WebSphere LTPA Keys . Select Format: LtpaToken and LtpaToken2 as the Use Token value.

step.cmd: In the Domino mail server document under Internet Protocols - Domino Web Engine, select Multiple Servers (SSO) as the session authentication.
Start the Domino and Sametime servers to apply the changes.
